title: Supersymmetry in Quantum Theory Over a Galois Field
abstract: As shown in our previous papers (hep-th/0209001 and reference therein), quantum theory based on a Galois field (GFQT) possesses a new symmetry between particles and antiparticles, which has no analog in the standard approach. In the present paper it is shown that this symmetry (called the AB one) is also compatible with supersymmetry. We believe this is a strong argument in favor of our assumption that the AB symmetry is a fundamental symmetry in the GFQT (and in nature if it is described by quantum theory over a Galois field). We also consider operatorial formulations of space inversion and X inversion in the GFQT. It is shown in particular that the well known fact, that the parity of bosons is real and the parity of fermions is imaginary, is a simple consequence of the AB symmetry.
